title: Tamil Nadu deputy chief minister says will take all steps to close down Vedanta's copper smelter
text:
Home » Tamil Nadu deputy chief minister says will take all steps to close down Vedanta’s copper smelter Tamil Nadu deputy chief minister says will take all steps to close down Vedanta’s copper smelter May 28, 2018 By Fatma Schwarz Leave a Comment
NEW DELHI (Reuters) – Tamil Nadu deputy head stated on Monday his authorities would take all steps to completely shut a copper smelter run by London-listed Vedanta Resources after lethal protests demanding its closure on environmental grounds. FILE PHOTO: A non-public safety guard stands in entrance of the principle gate of Sterlite Industries Ltd’s copper plant, a unit of London-based Vedanta Resources, in Tuticorin, in Tamil Nadu March 24, 2013. REUTERS/Stringer/File Photo
Residents and environmental activists say emissions from the plant, India’s second greatest, are polluting the air and water, affecting folks’s well being.
Resident have been demanding the closure of the plant, stated O. Panneerselvam, the deputy chief minister of Tamil Nadu. gtag('config', 'UA-114047264-2');
“The government will take all steps to permanently shut down the plant,” he advised reporters.
Last week, 13 have been killed after police opened fireplace on protesters demanding that the smelter within the port metropolis of Thoothukudi be shut down. Demonstrators shout slogans throughout a protest, after at the least 13 folks have been killed when police fired on protesters searching for closure of plant on environmental grounds on the town of Thoothukudi in Tamil Nadu, in Chennai, India, May 24, 2018.
